RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROYAL MAHOGANY broke awkwardly and lunged outward into Trappe The Bold then accelerated to the front approaching the three eighths pole, drew clear past the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the turn and was ridden out under a hand ride. POLITICAL DECISION had a brief early lead then gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and couldn't improve in the lane. SPEIGHTS YOUR MIND chased toward the inside, eased outward through the turn and entered the stretch widest, dug in the final furlong and took third under the wire. DANCIN IN DUBAI ducked in and made contact with Trappe the Gold leaving the gate, gave chase outside, raced in the five path on the turn and was nipped from third under the wire. BUBBA G chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. TRAPPE THE GOLD was pinched back and jostled soundly at the start but steadily improved his position, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. DINNER BELL gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Political Decision
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,chased 3/8,off rail turn,no lane gain

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,chased outside,5p turn,nipped 3rd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 21, 2022. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 21, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RRACE DAY WARRIOR stalked the earlier pace from the two and three paths, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead past the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn and was kept sharp through the stretch. NO FOOLING DUDE took a quick lead and moved in to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, was met past the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane and just lasted for second. FORT FORTITUDE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, eased out entering the stretch and just missed third in an even finish. MOON OVER MONTANA saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little more. ELEVATED FOREVER saved ground off the pace, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. EISELE raced in the three path the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. YOUSHOULDBESOLUCKY raced in the four path the first turn, bid from the three eighths pole but weakened in the five path on the far turn. ATTENTIVE rounded the first turn in the five path and raced wide.

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Fortitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,dug in lane,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R

ENTRY.NAME: Rrace Day Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2& 3p,bid 7/16,up past 1/4,clear mid turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDE THE RAPIDS rated the early pace inside but was met into the backstretch and raced close from that point, recovered the advantage toward the five sixteenths pole, contested the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. MARQUET CLASSIC came away awkwardly and exchanged contact with Looking For Flare at the break, stalked from the four path the first turn, took the lead into the backstretch but was met toward the five sixteenths pole, continued close two deep on the far turn, flattened inside the sixteenth pole but held on for second. HOLY HIP rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for third. DIAL FOR LOVE stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path then flattened in the stretch duel for third. ALL THE WAY MAE saved ground on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LOOKING FOR FLARE veered outward and exchanged contact with Marquet Classic leaving the gate, raced in the five path on the first turn and never factored. HONEYCAMP raced off the rail on the first turn and was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Hip
ENTRY.OWNER: C M Racing Stables LLC and Lewis Jalen

ENTRY.NAME: All the Way Mae
ENTRY.OWNER: Deiter Kelly Lynn and T J Albert Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, all owed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SING A LULLABYE rated the early pace inside, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, drifted under a left hand drive leaving the turn, varied paths through the upper stretch, though, held on well with steady handling. COWGIRL ATTITUDE chased through the backstretch and raced off the rail on the turn, steadied at the heels of the errant path of Sing A Lullabye into the lane, lugged in mid-stretch and was outfinished later yards. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE chased inside and raced near the rail on the turn, steadied in tight at the rail mid-stretch but came again and finished well. BLUE MOUNTAIN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. GLOBAL EMPRESS chased, raced two deep on the turn and showed little in the lane. MICHEAUX gave chase, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened. FIFTY GRAY SHADES gave chase and raced in the five path on the turn. PATTI BLUE EYES gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected claims of foul against the riders of both Sing A Lullabye, for interference leaving the turn, and Cowgirl Attitude for interference mid-stretch, lodged by the riders of Cowgirl Attitude and Knobiesmagicsonde respectively.

ENTRY.NAME: Sing a Lullabye
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,drifted 1/8,varying paths lane,held well drving

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirl Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,steadied into lane,lugged in 1/16,outfinishd

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,steadied rail 1/16,came again,finish well

ENTRY.NAME: Patti Blue Eyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John Cash is King LLC and LC Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 12300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: URBAN BANDIT stalked the early leader two deep then took over toward the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, drew clear at the rail into the far turn and held on well with steady handling. MUD BUG was reluctant to load then saved ground, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. MASTER THIS stalked from the three path, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, but dropped back nearing the head of the lane and flattened inside the eighth pole. CHROME HEIR raced well off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and improved his position in the six path on the far turn, but showed little in the lane. VOLIERO raced in the four path early then stalked through the front stretch, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded from the five sixteenths. PURSUING PACE left the second turn outside and gave chase from that point, but weakened approaching the far turn. UNION LEAGUE took the lead and moved to the inside on the first turn and raced with the early pace, was met approaching the three quarter pole, dropped back into the second turn and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, but weakened nearing the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Heir
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,chased 3/8,6p far turn,little lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD FIBER took the lead nearing the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, drifted toward mid-stretch then lugged in late and held on. HARDLY EVER BETTER had a brief early lead then pressured the pace, raced close off the rail on the turn, angled in from the heels of Gold Fiber mid-stretch then steadied at the rear of that one late stretch. TURTLE DOVE chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn, angled out leaving the turn and ran evenly in the lane. JUBA BOUND was kept in check near the rail through most of the backstretch, started a bid past the five sixteenths pole, angled to the three path midway on the turn but flattened stride mid-stretch. RIVER WARRIOR RVF gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. MAKIN' GOLD gave chase, entered the turn about the four path, left the turn in the six path and showed little more. DIXIE YODELER came away a bit rank and raced well back early. LEMONSONDESURPRISE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and was eased from mid-stretch. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Gold Fiber for interference through the stretch, lodged by the rider of Hardly Ever Better.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Bound
ENTRY.COMMENT: kept in check early,bid past 5/16,3p mid turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Turtle Dove
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Fiber
ENTRY.COMMENT: took over 3/8,set pressured pace,rail,drifted,lugged in,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Hardly Ever Better
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close off rail turn,steadied late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since September 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FULLY CONNECTED was hustled to the front toward the seven sixteenths pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure past the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn then drifted while driving and held on. BAYTOWN FROSTY chased through the backstretch and raced in range of the lead off the rail on the turn, was herded outward through the stretch and finished evenly. COMPANY CLOWN chased, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened later yards. STORM BOARDER (CHI) chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out from mid-stretch and finished evenly. FIZBO chased outside through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little further. INSIDE RISK gave chase, raced in the eight path on the turn and passed rivals widest. BAYTOWN WARRIOR gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and weakened in the lane. TIZ NO CLOWN gave chase and raced in the six path on the turn. PRIMAL DESTINY chased, then weakened off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: McEntee Racing Inc and Resolute Racing Alliance LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Primal Destiny
ENTRY.OWNER: Fitzpatrick Francis G and Muldoon William

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Frosty
ENTRY.OWNER: McEntee Racing Inc and Resolute Racing Alliance LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,range off rail turn,herded out lane,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NORLANDER stalked inside, gave chase past the three eighths pole and entered the far turn at the rail, angled to the five path approaching the head of the lane then dueled through the final sixteenth and edged clear nearing the wire. ROYAL AIR FORCE settled in the three path early, bid nearing the three eighths pole and challenged from the five sixteenths, raced close two deep on the far turn and dueled to a brief slim lead mid-stretch, but relented later yards. ICETECA saved ground off the pace, bid past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, eased out into the lane and dug in to take third the final yards. IRISH KING took over and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn but flattened the final sixteenth. CAIRO BREEZE settled off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole then flattened in the five path of the far turn. LORD GRANDE broke a step slow and loped along well back. DOUBLE MAKER rated close to the early pace about the three path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Iceteca
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 7/16,3p far turn,up 3rd final yards
